questions.text: 25-year-old male with history of smoking from past 11 years came with findings given below. Which of the following will be incorrect statement about this disorder?

necrotizing granulomas are feature of wegners granulomatosis

choices.text: Fish mouth stenosis is seen with acute RHD
Caterpillar like nuclear chromatin is seen in Anitschkow cells.
Fish mouth mitral stenosis is due to fibrosis and calcification.

questions.text: A 38-year-old male patient presented with severe dyspnea . On echocardiography, it was showing mitral stenosis with left atrium hypertrophy. Histopathology of vegetations from mitral, valve is seen as given in below Image. All of the following statements are true about this condition, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

.it is seen in chronic RHD

questions.text: A 30-year-old male suffers from congestive heart failure and died suddenly. He has no history of drug abuse, valvular disease, or systemic disorder. Myocardial histopathology is shown in the given image. These morphologic features are most consistent with which mutation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

This is Helter skelter myofibre disarray associated with beta-MHC mutation in hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy

questions.text: Based on below given images most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

wooly hairs.hyperkeratosis of soles ans fat replacement of myocytes are features of NAXOS Syndrome.

choices.text: IgA immune complex deposition in small blood vessels

questions.text: A 14-year-old patient comes to you with complaints of joint and abdominal pain. He reports having had an upper respiratory infection about a week ago. During  the examination, you notice certain features on his legs, as shown in the image. What is the underlying medical condition responsible for these symptoms?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

pt has HSP which is IgA mediated

choices.text: Its a Curschmann spiralis containing mucous plug
It is associated with type IlI Hypersensitivity reactions

questions.text: A patient with obstructive pulmonary disorder was examined cytologically and  finding is shown below. Which of the following is true about this image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Charcot leyden crystals are made up of galectin-10.

choices.text: Progression of lesion even after stopping exposure to asbestos.
Adenocarcinoma is most common cancer associated with asbestosis.

questions.text: Asbestosis of the lung is associated with all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nodular lesions involving upper lobe is feature of silicosis whereas asbestosis involves lower
lobe .

questions.text: 45-year-old male, an asbestos factory worker has presented with lung mass. Gross examination has revealed findings which are shown in image. Most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

single mass at base of lung with exposure to asbestosis is suggestive of mesothelioma

questions.text: A 45-year-old smoker presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied.  Histopathology is shown in given Image. Which of the following will be true about this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Azzopardi effect is feature of small cell ca which is positive for chromogranin.

choices.text: Most common paraneoplastic syndrome associated is clubbing of fingers
It will be positive for neurosecretory bodies
Salt and pepper like nuclear chromatin.
It is associated with Azzopardi effect.

questions.text: A 42-year-old smoker male presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied.H istopathology is shown in given Image. Which of the following is not true about this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

MC PNS of small cell is SIADH

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl is presenting with cola coloured urine. on physical examination her blood pressure was 154/100 mm Hg. Renal biopsy was performed and electron microscopy was showing the features shown in below given image. Most likely diagnosis in this case will be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Subepithelial hump is feature of PSGN or acute proliferative nephritis

choices.text: Semilunar structures consists of Parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and monocytes.

questions.solution:

Cresecents are characterstic of RPGN.

choices.text: Most commonly associated with Membranous nephropathy.

questions.text: Renal biopsy from a hematuria patient Who had malar rash and photosensitivity is given below. Which of the following is true about this Condition:

WIRE loop lesions in SLE suggest active ds and bad prognosis .Mc it is associated with class IV i.e doffuse proliferative GN.

questions.text: A 55 years old male presenting with periorbital edema, facial puffiness and massive proteinuria. Renal biopsy has revealed following features under Direct Immunofluorescence (DIF) and electron microscopy (EM) as shown in given picture. All of the following are true regarding this condition except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In membranous glomerulopathy there is no BM rupture.

questions.text: A patient with BP of 190/120 died and autopsy has shown findings given in image. Which of the following is not true about this condition:

Flea bitten kidney is feature of mailgnant HTN which does not show hyaline
arteriolosclerosis(Benign HTN)

choices.text: Vacuoles contain both glycogen and lipid.

questions.text: Renal mass was resected and following histopathology was seen. All of the following statements are true regarding this tumour, except:

clear cell ca a/w chr 3 deletion.Chromophobe is a/w loss of 1,2,6,7,10

questions.text: Histopathology of a 9 year old boy with brain tumour is shown below. Most likely it is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

these are rosenthal fibres seen in glial tumor i.e pilocytic astrocytoma and glial tumors are + for GFAP.

choices.text: Most common Primary Malignant brain tumor in adults.

True Palisading pattern of tumour cells are seen

questions.text: A 60 -year-old man presents with a 2-week history of tonic-clonic seizures that initially involve his left arm but have more recently progressed to involve his left leg. The seizures are accompanied by muscle weakness but no other eurologic signs. A CT scan reveals a mass in the left cerebral hemisphere.A left frontoparietal craniotomy is performed. Histologic examination of the brain biopsy is shown in the image. Which of the following is not true about this tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

this is pseudopalisading seen in glioblastoma.

questions.text: A 10-year-old patient with brain tumour came, and biopsy was taken and shown below in image. Which of the following is false :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

medulloblastoma has pseudorossetes containing neuron component i.e neuropil having pink lumen

choices.text: Most commonly arise from inferior vestibular branch of 8th cranial nerve.
Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni A areas.

questions.text: Histopathology of a Patient with CP angle mass is shown below. Which of the following is not true?
questions.solution:

flexner winterstiener rossetes associated with retinoblastoma

questions.text: A 45-year-old female was analysed for heartburn history from past 2 months.He also give history of food allergies. Endoscopy, double contrast esophagogram, and biopsy finding is shown below. Which of the following is incorrect about this condition
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) this is eosionophilic esophagitis or feline esophagus which is more then 15 eosinophils/hpf.

questions.solution:

mucosal thickness remains same in celiac ds.

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy was having abdominal pain and malena from past two years. His clinical and radiological examination has revealed the findings consistent with intussusception. Histopathology of lesion is shown below in given image. Which of the following is most likely to be associated with this condition:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PJ Syndrome shows christamas tree pattern and is a/w STK 11 gene mutation.

questions.text: 27.A 50-year-old female presenting with right breast lump from past 9 months. She also complaints about headaches associated with nausea for the past 2 months. An H and E stained section is shown in the figure. Which of the following is incorrect about this breast tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

mucin pools is feature of colloid ca or mucinous ca.

questions.text: A 43-year-old-female with breast cancer was showing Luminal Type C. Which of the following is true regarding this cancer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

luminal type C is ER-,PR-,HER 2 NEU + which shows poor prognosis. Trastuzumab is
Monoclonal Ab against her 2 neu receptor.

choices.text: Oct3 and oct 4 are molecular markers
Beta- HCG is a tumour marker.

questions.text: A 43-year-old male came with complains of a vague feeling of painless heaviness in the left scrotum from past 10 months. Testicular mass was resected, gross and histopathology findings are shown below in given image. Which of the following are true about this lesion
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

grossly hemorrhagic/necrotic mass on gross and giant cells( syncytiotrophoblasts) suggest choriocarcinoma .tumor maker is bhcg.

choices.text: Most common testicular tumor in pubertal age group

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy was noticed to be having left testicular mass by his parents. An orchiectomy was performed, and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following is not true about this tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

schiller duval bodies seen in Yolk sac tumor.it is most commonly seen in children and not in pubertal age group

questions.text: A 23-year-old boy was noticed to be having testicular mass • An orchiectomy was performed, Gross and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following tumor marker will be seen in this tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

gross grey white lobulated mass and microscopic feature showing nests of tumor cells
seperated by fibrous septa containing lymphocytes are seen in seminoma.Also tumor cells show peri nuclear clearing .Tumor markers are LDH,PLAP and beta HCG.

questions.text: A35-year-old female presented with anterior neck swelling. During childhood she was exposed to radiation. Histopathology of swelling is shown in image. All of the following are true about this condition except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

image shows optically clear chromatin with nuclear grooves. These are features of papillary thyroid ca which have lymphatic spread.

questions.text: 55 years old man is presenting with blurring of vision and massive proteinuria. Fundus examination of eye has revealed cotton wool spots, and dot and blot hemorrhage. Renal biopsy was done for evaluation and is shown below. Most Likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Blurring of visison,Cotton wool spots,dot and blot hemorrhage suggest diabetic
retinopathy.Given image shows nodular glomerulosclerosis which is signified by oval pink nodules at periphery.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man has had increasing shortness of breath and breath sounds are decreased in all lung fields. He has family history of liver disease and he had developed marked icterus as a neonate. His liver biopsy stained with PAS shows histopathology given in image. This patient is having high risk for development of which of the following conditions?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PAS positive inclusions in hepatocyte suggest alpha 1 AT defeciency and these patients are prone to develop emphysema.

choices.text: Ground glass hepatocytes of hepatitis-B virus

questions.text: LIVER biopsy showing characteristic cells shown in image. Most Likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hepatocytes showing eosinophilic granular glassy cytoplasm suggest ground glass
hepatocytes seen in hepatitis B Infection

questions.text: All of the following are true about Peutz-jeghers syndrome, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PJ syndrome is an AD disorder which occurs d/t mutation of APC gene.

questions.text:
Which of the following is correct
A.For Serological diagnosis of PSGN, anti-DNAase antibody is better than ASO Ab
B.Most common pattern of inheritence in ALPORT syndrome is XLD. .
C.Crescents are made up of parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and Leucocytes
D.On immunofluorescence of Goodpasture syndrome, granular deposits (IgG and C3) are
seen.
Options are:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

GPS shows linear pattern is seen as it is antibody mediated disorder.

questions.text: A 18-Year-old male presents with hematuria and anterior lens subluxation.Urinalysis shows , no ketones, no glucose, 1+ blood, and no leukocytes. A renal biopsy reveals tubular epithellal foam cells by Light microscopy. By electron microscopy the glomerular basement membrane shows areas of attenuation, with splitting and lamination of lamina dense in other thickened areas. The most probable diagnosis is-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Male child with deafness ,lens subluxation, hematuria suggest ALPORT Syndrome which show Basket weave appearance i.e splitting of lamina densa of Basement Membrane

questions.text: A 41 year-old man presented with painless hematuria. Bimanual Examination revealed a mass over the right flank. Subsequently right nephrectomy was done and the mass was seen to be composed of cells with clear cytoplasm. Cytogenetic analysis o this mass is likely to reveal the abnormality of-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Clear cell carcinoma occurs in VHL syndrome which occurs d/t chr 3p deletion

choices.text: Turbulent blood flow through an incompetent mitral valve
Bacterial colonization of an abnormal valve
Cachexia produced by a hypercoagulable state

questions.text: At the time of autopsy of a 49-year-old female who had malar rash, several medium sized¬†vegetations are found on both sides of the mitral valve and tricuspid valve. These cardiac¬†vegetations are most likely the result of -
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Anticardiolipin antibody are seen in SLE which involve both sides of valves, .

questions.text: Histopathology section shows this image from a patent who died of Myocardial infarction. This change will be seen occur after
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Coagulative necrosis along with brisk neutrophilic infiltrate suggest infarct age of 1-3 days

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl who is normally developed has chronic progressive exercise intolerance. On physical Examination, temperature is 37.1°C, pulse is 70/min, respirations are 14/min, and blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg. A chest radiograph shows cardiomegaly and mild pulmonary edema. An echocardiogram shows severe left ventricular hypertrophy and a prominent interventricular septum. The right ventricle is slightly thickened. The ejection fraction is abnormally high, and the ventricular volume and cardiac output are both low. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the cardiac abnormalities in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Prominent interventricular septum and left ventricular hypertrophy with high ejection fraction
and low interventriular volume suggest HOCM which is caused by beta myosin heavy chain
mutation
